body_html:
@helloiamsourav @kirk86
Hi. Good news. I have built the tensorflow working with CUDA9.1
just go to my repo: https://repo.puyuwang.me/ to download it.
Make sure you download the right version (I built for both python2.x and 3.6 environments)
And if you want to build the binary on your own , you probably would encounter some errors with CUDA9.1.(most likely a header files error) It could be resovled by a quick hack:simply link the header files to the cuda/include directory.

@helloiamsourav @kirk86
Hi. Good news. I have built the tensorflow working with CUDA9.1

Make sure you download the right version  (I built for both python2.x and 3.6 environments)
And if you want to build the binary on your own , you probably would encounter some errors with CUDA9.1.(most likely a header files error) It could be resovled by a quick hack:simply link the header files to the cuda/include directory.
body:
@helloiamsourav @kirk86 
Hi. Good news. I have built the tensorflow working with CUDA9.1
just go to my repo: https://repo.puyuwang.me/ to download it. 
Make sure you download the right version  (I built for both python2.x and 3.6 environments)
And if you want to build the binary on your own , you probably would encounter some errors with CUDA9.1.(most likely a header files error) It could be resovled by a quick hack:simply link the header files to the cuda/include directory.
